numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice something.
2. Some colleges say that legacy applicants do not matter much in an application.
3. Some colleges say that the income of the parents does not matter much in an application.
4. However, legacy status can make a big difference in an application.
5. Also, the income of the parents can make a big difference in an application.
6. The graph has a legacy line.
7. The legacy line is the top line.
8. The legacy line is black.
9. The graph has a non-legacy line.
10. The non-legacy line is the bottom line.
11. The non-legacy line is grey.
12. The graph has a grey area between the legacy line and the non-legacy line.
13. As the income of the parents increases, the grey area grows.
14. I wonder why they skewed the x-axis at the end.
15. I wonder what purpose the y-axis on the right has.
16. The y-axis is on the right and not on the left.
17. Many colleges are similar to the elite colleges in this data.
18. Some colleges are not in the limelight for this graph.
19. This pattern may apply to most schools.
20. This pattern may affect college choices.
21. This pattern may affect what school counselors tell students.
22. This pattern may affect what teachers tell students.
23. School counselors may tell students where they should apply.
24. Teachers may tell students where they should apply.
25. School counselors may tell students where they might not get in.
26. Teachers may tell students where they might not get in.
27. The headline is: Legacy and Income: How these 2 factors can change whether you get into your top college or not.
